name: politico
text: Yesterday the Trump administration revealed the names of more than 650,000 employers that secured billions in emergency small business aid — including Washington interest groups, businesses tied to lawmakers and some well-known consumer brands https://t.co/BApGzyyfwh

name: politico
text: Among the loan recipients were private equity-backed restaurant groups Five Guys, P.F. Chang's and TGI Friday's https://t.co/BApGzyyfwh

name: politico
text: The Americans for Tax Reform Foundation, which touts the benefits of smaller government, got aid. So did the Congressional Black Caucus Foundation and the Congressional Hispanic Caucus Institute. https://t.co/BApGzyyfwh

name: politico
text: Religious organizations and Goodwill Industries obtained funds, as did about 40 Planned Parenthood affiliates https://t.co/BApGzyyfwh

name: politico
text: The law firm founded by David Boies — who represented Al Gore in the 2000 election recount and defended Harvey Weinstein — took a loan https://t.co/BApGzyyfwh

name: politico
text: And Kanye West's company, Yeezy LLC, received a loan for $2 million to $5 million https://t.co/BApGzyyfwh
